summary:
## Challenger Deep: Earth's Deepest Point

The Challenger Deep is the deepest place on Earth, located in the Mariana Trench in the Pacific Ocean. It's about 11,000 meters (36,000 feet) below sea level.  It was first discovered by a British ship, HMS Challenger, in the 1870s and later explored by the bathyscaphe Trieste in 1960. Only 27 people have ever visited this extreme depth.
title: Challenger Deep
